intro: Tolpis liouvillei, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. It produces bulbous roots and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Tolpis liouvillei is also valued for its resilience and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
